title: No Warm Inflation From Sphaleron Heating With a Vanilla Axion
abstract:
At finite temperature, the coupling of an axion to non-Abelian gauge fields
causes dissipation due to sphaleron heating. This mechanism is ideally suited
for realizing warm inflation since it can lead to large thermal friction while
preserving the flatness of the potential. We show, however, that requiring
standard properties of an axion $-$ in particular a discrete shift symmetry and
a potential generated non-perturbatively by instanton effects $-$ excludes the
strong regime of warm slow-roll inflation, in which thermal friction dominates.
The derivation of this result does not require any phenomenological input.
While non-minimal (axion-like) models provide a way out, sphaleron heating with
a standard axion is capable of enabling the weak regime of warm inflation.
